meanings.definition: To serve as a sign or signal of something to come.
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds harbingered the approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: The first snowflakes harbingered the start of winter.
meanings.sent3: The chirping of birds harbingered the dawn of a new day.
meanings.sent4: The distant thunder harbingered the impending rain.
meanings.sent5: The sudden silence in the forest harbingered an approaching predator.

meanings.definition: To announce or indicate the approach of something.
meanings.sent1: The ringing of the bell harbingered the start of the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The smell of fresh bread harbingered the arrival of breakfast.
meanings.sent3: The loud footsteps harbingered the approach of an unexpected guest.
meanings.sent4: The distant sound of music harbingered the upcoming festival.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights of the city harbingered the end of their long journey.

meanings.definition: To foreshadow or presage an event.
meanings.sent1: The sudden drop in temperature harbingered the coming snowstorm.
meanings.sent2: The eerie silence in the house harbingered the ghostly presence.
meanings.sent3: The old legend harbingered the mysterious disappearance of the treasure.
meanings.sent4: The howling wind harbingered the arrival of a powerful storm.
meanings.sent5: The flickering lights in the sky harbingered the start of the fireworks show.
